metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
To the Honble [honorable] the President, and Members of the St Andrew Club in Charles Town South Carolina --

Most Humbly Sheweth, that your Petitioner is William Stevenson from the Parish of Maybole, Shire of Air [i.e. Ayr], North Brittain [Britain], was owner of a Coasting Vessell [vessel], had the Missfortune [misfortune] to be Shipwrecked on the Island of Tobego, and lost his all, he Procured Passage to this Place was Imediatly [immediately] Seized with the Fever and ague, of which these many months Past he has laboured under sore afflictions with, and for want of money to employ a Surgeon, he has lost the use of one of his arms, by which he is now incapable to gain any Support for his life -- He would most humbly beg your goodness, and humanity, will take his Poor and Miserable condition before you, and grant him any support, you may think fite [fit] -- And your Petitioner Shall ever Pray for health, and Prosperity -- 

Chas. Town
30 Novr. 1774
